Sentencas: The development of the Molten Carbonate Fuel Cell, now 65 years old in its pure molten-salt cell embodiment, has spawned a remarkable variety of designs and technologies (gas-fed fuel cells, direct carbon fuel cells, solid oxide FC hybrids, CO2 concentrating/capture and hydrogen generating systems).
Titulo: MOLTEN SALT FUEL CELLS: Diversity and convergence, cycles and recycling

Sentencas: Sometimes these new subsets are recycling ideas from earlier stages of fuel cell exploration - which extend quite far back.
Titulo: MOLTEN SALT FUEL CELLS: Diversity and convergence, cycles and recycling

Sentencas: Since Grove's discovery in 1840, diversification of the fuel has been a persistent lure and challenge - which led to exploration of ionic melts.
Titulo: MOLTEN SALT FUEL CELLS: Diversity and convergence, cycles and recycling

Sentencas: Much later, after the isolation and identification of solid-oxide conductors, the path to a purely carbonate cell became conceptually clear.
Titulo: MOLTEN SALT FUEL CELLS: Diversity and convergence, cycles and recycling

Sentencas: Its history since then has had several critical points, of diversification and convergence.
Titulo: MOLTEN SALT FUEL CELLS: Diversity and convergence, cycles and recycling

Sentencas: Like all energy technologies, it is forever at the mercy of the economics, and politics, of primary energy resources - the balance between fossil and renewable.
Titulo: MOLTEN SALT FUEL CELLS: Diversity and convergence, cycles and recycling

Sentencas: Is MCFC a technology whose time has come ... and gone?
Titulo: MOLTEN SALT FUEL CELLS: Diversity and convergence, cycles and recycling

Sentencas: Such a view would ignore its strong chemical fundamentals, intrinsic to a future including biofuels.
Titulo: MOLTEN SALT FUEL CELLS: Diversity and convergence, cycles and recycling

Sentencas: But controlling and stabilizing the morphology and wetting properties of MCFC materials is vital for another cycle of re-birth and flowering.
Titulo: MOLTEN SALT FUEL CELLS: Diversity and convergence, cycles and recycling
